articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Russian Figures
Forum in Philippines Supports DPRK
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Russian Figures 
    Pyongyang, January 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by Sazhi Umalatova, chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, V. P. Yeliseev, chief of the Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior, and Solinov, general manager of the Institute of Technical Glass Science of Russia, on the occasion of the New Year.
 The gifts were separately conveyed to DPRK officials concerned in Russia on Dec. 28 and 29.

articles.title: New Year's Greetings to Kim Jong Il
Solidarity Actions for Settlement of Issue of "Comfort Women" Called for
articles.content:
New Year's Greetings to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, January 2 (KCNA) -- Congratulatory messages and letters came to General Secretary Kim Jong Il from the Standing Council of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, the Central Standing Board of Directors of the Korean Youth Commercial Association in Japan, the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Teachers and School Clerks in Japan, the Standing Council of the Union of Korean Central Education Association in Japan, the Central Standing Council of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, the Korean Human Rights Federation in Japan, the Standing Council of the Korean Amateur Athletic Federation in Japan, the Central Standing Committee of Korean Students Union in Japan, the Korean Association for Peace and Reunification in Japan and other organizations of Chongryon and their affiliated bodies, th
 e Choson Sinbo Company, the Korean News Service, the Hagu Bookshop, the Kumgang-san Opera Troupe, the Tonghae Ltd, the Kumgang Insurance Company, the Korean Goods Sales Company, the Committee for Promoting Korea-Japan Economic Exchange, the Federation of Joint Economic Venture of Korean Residents in Japan, the Centre for Consulting Marriage of Korean Youth in Japan and other enterprises, various local headquarters of Chongryon, Joson University and Korean schools at other levels and Koreans in Japan on the occasion of the New Year Juche 96 (2007). 
 Greeting the New Year to witness fresh victories and glory to be recorded in the history of the country, they in their messages and letters offered highest glory and warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Il, the brilliant sun of the 21st century and benevolent father of Chongryon and the Koreans in Japan, representing their profound veneration.
 They wholeheartedly wished him good health for the accomplishment of the cause of Juche and the prosperity and development of the socialist country and for the steady growth and development of the movement of the Koreans in Japan.
